dict.string: Multiply first digit by itself +1, put 25 on the end. 35 x 35 = 1225
Double the number, then double again. 36 x 4 = 72 x 2 = 144
Half the number. If the result is a whole number, add a 0 to the end. If not, ignore the remainder and add a 5 to the end.
Hold out ten fingers, drop the corresponding finger of the number you're multiplying. The fingers left to the left are the tens digit, and on the right are the ones.
Add two digits together, insert answer between them. 21 x 11 = 231
Mutliply by 10, then add 5 times the original number.
Double the number, move the decimal point to the left. 87 / 5 = 17.4
Starting from the left, subtract all digits from 9, bar the last one. 1000 - 345 = [9-3][9-4][10-5] = 655
